title: The PC game releases we're most excited about in July
description: Remnant 2, Capcom's weird dino game, horses in The Sims 4, and more from July's PC release calendar.

title: The Lord of the Rings: Gollum dev pulling out of making new games after The Lord of the Rings: Gollum
description: Daedalic announced that it's axing its internal developer and focusing on its publishing business.

title: I spent hours tracking down a game I barely remembered from my childhood, and it turned out it was a screensaver
description: My favorite game turned out to be Johnny Castaway, the forefather of virtual pets.

title: Here's how to permanently wipe OneDrive folders from your PC if they keep recreating themselves
description: Even after you uninstall OneDrive, its presence can linger in Windows 11. Here's how to fix that.

title: Twitch phenomenon Only Up pulled from Steam
description: The developer says it will come back "soon." Only Up was accused of copyright infringement earlier this week.

title: The Sims 5 will be 'free-to-enter' according to EA job posting
description: Now that The Sims 4's free base game has paved the way, the next Sims game will follow.

title: What if Baldur's Gate 3 isn't just getting out of Starfield's way by launching a month early—what if it's better?
description: Baldur's Gate 3's new release date may be setting us up for another Disco Elysium vs The Outer Worlds situation.

title: Abandon your Diablo 4 builds: The bouncy Barbarian boy is now the only valid way to play
description: Turn your berserker hopping mad.

title: Someone made a ChatGPT-powered bot that says 'dumb things that are somewhat funny' to waste telemarketers' time
description: Finally, get some sweet revenge on those annoying telemarketers and record it for your pleasure.

title: The hunt's over: all 6 of Diablo 4's mega-rare items have been discovered
description: The last piece of the loot puzzle has fallen into place.

title: AMD's Ryzen 5 5600X3D sounds like a killer budget gaming chip we could do without being limited edition
description: The $230 chip will be exclusive to Micro Center, and thus, also the US.

title: Pokemon GO developer Niantic cuts workforce by a quarter after struggling to make lightning strike twice
description: Cancelled projects include Marvel: World of Heroes and NBA All-World.

title: Amid national riots over a police shooting, the French president blames the unrest on videogames
description: The rioters are acting like they're in "the videogames that have intoxicated them."

title: Devs casually expose far-reaching loading bar conspiracy: 'People just don’t trust one that’s too quick'
description: This one goes all the way to the top (after getting stuck on 78% for a few seconds).

title: Microsoft CEO says he'd 'love to get rid' of console exclusives but it's all Sony's fault, your honor
description: "I have no love for that world."

title: Psychonauts creator Tim Schafer says he's never read anything that was 'meaningful, important or worthwhile' created by AI
description: While he's impressed by the tech, he's yet to be moved by it.

title: Microsoft's light-based computer marks 'the unravelling of Moore's Law'
description: Analog, iterative machines ditch binary transistor switches for photons and electrons to process at the speed of light.

title: Diablo 4 player churns through 1,270 cellars in three days, just for the hell of it
description: The things we do for gamer science.

title: Cache is king when it comes to designing the gaming CPUs of the next 20 years
description: Facing a power wall and the limit of physics, chip makers are in a constant battle to reengineer and re-evaluate ways to build a better CPU.

title: The spirit of PC building will keep our gaming machines from disappearing into the cloud
description: "Similar to how muscle cars from the '50s haven't disappeared, the love for building your own desktop PC from the ground up... will make desktop PCs prevail."

title: We're on the brink of the biggest changes to computing's DNA and it's not just quantum that's coming
description: We're not at the tipping point yet, however. The hardware is still nascent and "the thing that we haven't cracked yet is the software."

title: Silicon won't run our gaming PCs forever but it's far from finished
description: The sheer mass of manufacturing might behind silicon will keep it thriving for a long time even if there are better options out there.

title: Call of Duty gets into psychological warfare as new anti-cheat tech plagues hackers with 'hallucinations'
description: Fairly certain this is a violation of like five different international treaties.

title: Windows AI Copilot has just hit Windows Insider builds
description: "Copilot, delete System 32."

title: The 6 best and most brutal baddies in Diablo
description: Which villain reigns supreme?

title: Hold on, weren't Intel's desktop Meteor Lake-S chips cancelled? Maybe not
description: Support comes to Linux.

title: Today's Wordle hint and answer #741: Friday, June 30
description: Get all the help you need with today's Wordle.
